title: ExcelCOUNT Function

metadata.description: Learn about ExcelCOUNT Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel
COUNT Function

COUNT Function
The
COUNT
function is a premade function in Excel
content_sections.content: , which counts cells with numbers in a range.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=COUNT
Note:
The
COUNT
function only counts cells with numbers,
not
cells
with letters
. The
COUNTA
function is better used if the cells have letters.

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=COUNT
Double click the
COUNT
command
Select a range
Hit enter
Let's see some examples!

content_sections.title: Apply the
content_sections.content:
=COUNT
function to range
D2:D21
. Counting the cells of Pokemon Total stats, which is numbers only:
Name	Type 1	Type 2	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting		305
    Poliwrath	Water	Fighting	510
    Victreebel	Grass	Poison	490
    Tentacool	Water	Poison	335
    Magneton	Electric	Steel	465
    Dewgong	Water	Ice	475
    Cloyster	Water	Ice	525
    Onix	Rock	Ground	385
    Dragonair	Dragon		420
    Pidgeotto	Normal	Flying	349
    Rattata	Normal		253
    Beedrill	Bug	Poison	395
    Doduo	Normal	Flying	310
    Kingler	Water		475
    Nidoqueen	Poison	Ground	505
    Hitmonchan	Fighting		455
    Charmeleon	Fire		405
    Arbok	Poison		438
    Gastly	Ghost	Poison	310
    Magikarp	Water		200
Copy Values
COUNT
function, step by step:
Select
D23

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=COUNT
Double click
COUNT
in the menu
Select range
D2:D21
Hit enter
Note:

content_sections.title: The
content_sections.content:
=COUNT
function only counts cells with numbers in a range.
That's it! The
=COUNT
function successfully counted 20 cells with numbers.
A Non-Working Example
Now, let us try an example that will not work.

content_sections.title: Apply the
content_sections.content:
=COUNT
function to the range
A2:A21
, which only has cells with letters.
It returns the value
0
, no cells with numbers found. Range
A2:A21
only had cells with letters.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers ExcelCOUNT Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ExcelCOUNT Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ExcelCOUNT Function and how to apply it in your projects.
